snippet: As organizers scramble to assure the public that the Games will be safe, lawmakers appear to be drawing different conclusions.
abstract: Organizers of the London Olympics try to assure a skeptical nation that a drastic shortfall in security personnel, which has forced the deployment of military reinforcements, would not compromise the safety of the Games; lawmakers who interrogated the head of the global security company, G4S, which has failed to meet contractual obligations to secure a guaranteed security staff of 10,400, concedes company's failure.
lead_paragraph: As organizers scramble to assure the public that the Games will be safe, lawmakers appear to be drawing different conclusions.

headline.main: British Parliament Investigates Shortfall in Olympics Security
headline.print_headline: British Parliament Investigates Shortfall in Olympics Security
